title: Region / state roundup : Tides game postponed for second straight day due to poor air quality
body_text:
MINOR LEAGUE BASEBALL
For the second straight day, the Norfolk Tides’ game at Scranton/Wilkes-Barre has been postponed due to poor air quality as a result of smoke from wildfires in Canada.
The teams are now scheduled to start their series at 6:35 p.m. Thursday. It hasn’t been determined if doubleheaders will be played to make up the postponed games.
The Triple-A debut of the Tides’ Heston Kjerstad will be on hold for another day. The Orioles promoted the No. 2 overall pick of the 2020 MLB Draft from Double-A Bowie on Monday.
Kjerstad, who has played in the outfield and at first base, is ranked No. 50 on the MLB Top 100 prospect list.
COLLEGE BASEBALL
UVA’s Teel Posey Award finalist
University of Virginia catcher Kyle Teel is one of three finalists for the Buster Posey Catcher of the Year Award, becoming the first UVA player to be named a finalist for the honor.
Louisville’s Jack Payton and Lamar’s Ryan Snell are the other finalists.
Teel, the 2023 ACC Player of the Year, is hitting .423 with a school-record 25 doubles along with 13 homers and 64 RBIs.
He is also a finalist for the Dick Howser Trophy and the Golden Spikes Award.
Meanwhile, UVA third baseman Jake Gelof has been named the Baseball Division I CSC Academic All-America Team Member of the Year. He is a first-team Academic All-America selection for the second straight season.
UVA will host Duke in a super regional series this weekend.
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
Pair of Ga. players commit to UVA
Snellville (Georgia) South Gwinnett High cornerback Jaylin Lackey and Roswell (Georgia) High defensive end Chase Morrison have each committed to the University of Virginia, both announced Wednesday on Twitter.
The Cavaliers have picked up four commitments in three days.
Lackey, 6-0 and 185 pounds, is a three-star prospect, according to 247Sports. He was also considering Georgia Tech, Georgia Southern, Georgia State and Elon among others.
The 6-foot-4, 240-pound Morrison collected 109 tackles and 11 sacks last season. He is ranked 78th among edge rushers in the 2024 class by 247Sports.
Morrison had offers from Duke, Indiana, Wake Forest, James Madison, Liberty, Tulane, South Florida, Marshall, Air Force, East Carolina and Florida Atlantic among others.
LOCAL BASEBALL
Morehead City drops Pilots to 0-4
Dan Tauken’s two-run home run highlighted a seven-run fourth inning in Morehead City’s 9-2 victory over the Peninsula Pilots on Tuesday night.
The Pilots surrendered five unearned runs and fell to 0-4.
Peninsula’s Cole Stanford hit a solo home run and Dalton Barham (Norfolk State) pitched 3.2 scoreless innings.
Briefly
- Wednesday night’s soccer match between Lionsbridge FC and Greenville United has been canceled due to unhealthy air quality as a result of the smoke drift from the wildfires in Canada. The game won’t be rescheduled because of the teams’ scheduling conflicts. Fans who purchased a single-game ticket can exchange it for a future Lionsbridge game this season or get a refund.
- Norfolk State placed a record 106 student-athletes on the MEAC Commissioner’s All-Academic Team. It broke the previous mark of 101 from 2020-21.
- The Virginia Tech women’s basketball team will play NCAA runner-up Iowa in the Ally Tipoff on Nov. 9 at the Spectrum Center in Charlotte, North Carolina. The contest will be available on ESPN platforms, with specific details announced at a later date.
- Four Christopher Newport men’s lacrosse players picked up All-America honors from the Intercollegiate Men’s Lacrosse Coaches Association. Andrew Cook and Ryan Young made the first team, while Warner Cabaniss and Campbell Pozin are on the second team.
